vehicles.description: On the street ahead, a white car is parked on the left side, its body slightly angled towards the road, indicating that it may be preparing to merge into traffic or leave the parking space.
vehicles.explanation: Since the intentions of that vehicle are unclear, our car should be ready to respond to it entering our lane at any time.

vulnerable_road_users.description: On the left side of the sidewalk, pedestrians can be seen, including a group of students who appear to be accompanied by adults, with some people close to the edge of the crossing area.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Given the proximity to the pedestrian crosswalk, there is a possibility that pedestrians may enter the roadway, therefore the vehicle must be driven with caution.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A traffic officer is standing on the right side of the pedestrian crossing, wearing a high-visibility vest, appearing to be managing the traffic and pedestrian flow.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The presence of a police officer may indicate a temporary traffic control situation, requiring autonomous vehicles to follow any gestures or instructions.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A cyclist is moving towards my vehicle on the opposite lane.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Motorcyclists are vulnerable road users; when driving a car, one should maintain a safe distance when overtaking or when the motorcyclist is changing lanes.

traffic signs.description: On the right side of the road, there is a "No Parking" sign.
traffic signs.explanation: This sign reminds drivers that stopping is not allowed at this spot on the street to ensure smooth traffic flow.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, there is a white car parked on the left side of the street ahead. Its body is slightly angled towards the road, which may suggest that the driver is preparing to merge into traffic or leave the parking space. Due to the unclear intentions of the parked vehicle, our autonomous car should remain alert and ready to respond to the possibility of the car entering our lane.

On the sidewalk to the left, there is a group of pedestrians, including students accompanied by adults. Some individuals are close to the edge of the crossing area. The proximity to the pedestrian crosswalk means there is a risk of pedestrians stepping onto the roadway, and as such, our vehicle must proceed with caution in this area.

Additionally, a traffic officer is present on the right side of the pedestrian crossing. The officer is wearing a high-visibility vest and seems to be directing traffic and pedestrian flow. This situation may require the autonomous vehicle to be prepared to follow any hand signals or instructions given by the officer.

There is also a cyclist moving towards our vehicle in the opposite lane. Cyclists are considered vulnerable road users, and it is important for our vehicle to maintain a safe distance when overtaking or in case the cyclist decides to change lanes.

On the right side of the road, a "No Parking" sign is visible. This sign indicates that stopping is not permitted at that location, which is important for maintaining a smooth flow of traffic.

The JSON data does not include any traffic lights, traffic cones, barriers, or other objects in the image, indicating that these elements are not present or not relevant in this scenario.

driving_suggestion: When driving, one must proceed with caution, especially when nearing a pedestrian crossing where schoolchildren and traffic police are present. Be prepared to yield to pedestrians and follow the instructions of the traffic police (if present). Additionally, closely monitor vehicles parked on the left side of the road ahead to prevent them from entering your lane. Also, maintain a safe distance from motorcycles to accommodate sudden stops or changes in speed. Since there are no traffic light signals, rely on traffic rules and any instructions from traffic police when crossing intersections. Exercise caution when passing tricycles parked on the left, and be vigilant for any unexpected movements.

1.description and explanation: This is a three-wheeled vehicle with a cabin, often used for small-scale transport of goods. Due to its larger size and slower speed compared to bicycles or motorcycles, the driver of the ego car must take caution when overtaking or passing by, ensuring there's enough space and that doing so is legal and safe in the given road conditions.

2.description and explanation: This is a traffic cone, typically used to signal temporary changes in a traffic pattern or to mark off areas where work is being done or hazards exist. The presence of a traffic cone indicates that the ego vehicle should remain alert for potential obstacles or changes in the usual flow of traffic and may need to adjust its course to avoid the marked area.
